value.title: Say No to Export Data, Yes to Analyze in Excel   Power BI and Excel Can Talk
value.excerpt: Despite the fact that I have explained about the Analyze in Excel feature in Power BI before, still, I hear and see many users are using the Export data option in Power BI much more. In this video, I am explaining what is the difference and why it is better to use Analyze in Excel rather than exporting
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TfTmzRMqjz0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Script for Creating TIME Table in Power BI with Hours, Minutes and Seconds Buckets
value.excerpt: I have a Power Query script that I usually use in any Power BI solution that needs time-based analysis. However, I never had a chance to publish it here for everyone to use. So here it is. A friend's question about a time table reminded me that it is good to publish this to the public. This is a script

value.title: Unpivot in Power BI and Power Query Transforming Budget Data from Columns to Rows
value.excerpt: Turning columns to rows or rows to columns is easy with Power Query and Power BI. There are many situations that you get a name, value data source, and wants to convert that into columns with values underneath. On the other hand, many times you get multiple columns and want to change it to name, value

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tONOosN1xAs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Comparing with previous selected time period in DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes how you can create a comparison with the previous time period in a visualization, regardless of whether the time periods are consecutive or not: https://sql.bi/526183/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables)  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JBN-x2duxSU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. Article and download: https://sql.bi/27271/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Customize default values for each user in Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Learn how to use calculation groups to define a default set of values for columns in your model. Different users can have different default values, and yet retain the full capability to select different values. Article and download: https://sql.bi/717242?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZHlC55APxPs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Displaying filter context in Power BI Tooltips
value.excerpt: Display the filter context applied to a calculation using a special DAX measure in Power BI Tooltips. Article and download: https://sql.bi/79070?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kccmckYOmbw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: How to enable the Single Value option in a Power BI slicer
value.excerpt: This video describes how to enable the Single Value slicer option in Power BI by adding additional metadata to the model with Tabular Editor. Article and download: https://sql.bi/728090?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use variables to optimize the performance of DAX expressions containing multiple instances of the same measure or the same sub-expression. There are two related articles and downloads: https://sql.bi/62887/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables) https://sql.bi/67786/?aff=yt

value.title: Sorting months in fiscal calendars in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows a basic technique used to sort months according to a fiscal calendar, by using a couple of calculated columns and the “sort by column” feature of Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/492713?aff=yt

value.title: Understanding the difference between LASTDATE and MAX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains why in many cases, MAX should be used instead of LASTDATE to search for the last date in a time period using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/673766?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xZyJlgE1RsI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: USERELATIONSHIP in calculated columns
value.excerpt: Learn why USERELATIONSHIP is easy to work with in measures, but it can be challenging and give you inaccurate results when used in calculated columns. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Using calculation groups to switch between different dates
value.excerpt: Use calculation groups to change the active relationship in a model in order to let users choose among multiple dates in a Power BI report. Article and download: https://sql.bi/684295?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kilQrRR04mY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l5JX3G5Ntzk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Wholesale and retail execution in composite models
value.excerpt: In composite models, any query can be executed on the remote model (wholesale execution) or by mixing local and remote engines together (retail execution). This video describes the differences between the wholesale and retail modes in composite models. Article and download: https://sql.bi/736550?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/beSY3VotZVI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Working below a DAX formula’s granularity
value.excerpt: How to control the result of a DAX measure used in a report with granularity below the granularity supported by the formula. Article and download: https://sql.bi/661463/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Solution Architect series: Evaluate Power Platform analytics and AI
value.excerpt: Learn about reporting and analytics in Microsoft Power Platform.

value.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Create reports with Power BI and Dataverse for Teams
value.excerpt: Dataverse for Teams - Build your first report with Power BI and Dataverse for Teams.

value.title: Add calculated tables and columns to Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll be able to add calculated tables and calculated columns to your data model. You'll also be able to describe row context, which is used to evaluated calculated column formulas. Because it's possible to add columns to a table using Power Query, you'll also learn when it's best to create calculated columns instead of Power Query computed columns.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

value.title: Power Platform - Introduction, business value, and demos
value.excerpt: Explore the capabilities of Power Platform applications, as seen in demonstrations and customer case studies.
